text.p: Here are the highlights from Swiss newspapers on Friday:
- The Swiss lower house of parliament allocated a four-year, 1.05 billion Swiss franc credit for international humanitarian projects.
- Swiss rail catering group Buffet Suisse was taken over by the Berlin-based Mitropa AG.
- The special Holocaust Memorial Fund has been raised to 265 million francs by a 65 million franc contribution from the Swiss Chamber of Industry.
- The Swiss cabinet proposed rule changes which would make it easier for foreign investors to buy or build facilities in Switzerland.
- Swiss electrical energy producer NOK reported a 1995/96 net profit of 49.4 million Swiss francs.
- Swiss regional airline Crossair reported record sales for 1996 of 738.3 million Swiss francs, up from 464.4 million. Profit climbed to 23 million francs from 17.5 million.
